body_html:
I also ran into this error today, the main issue seems to be that the error messages on CPU/GPU are not matching and the GPU error message is somewhat confusing.

On CPU, you get the proper message:

RuntimeError: Calculated padded input size per channel: (2 x 2). Kernel size: (4 x 4). Kernel size can't greater than actual input size at [...]

On GPU it renders as

Expected tensor for argument #1 'input' to have the same dimension as tensor for 'result'; but 4 does not equal 2 (while checking arguments for cudnn_convolution)

So @yngtodd, providing the network with a larger input (or adapting the network architecture) will likely fix your issue.

(PyTorch Version: 0.4.0)

body:
I also ran into this error today, the main issue seems to be that the error messages on CPU/GPU are not matching and the GPU error message is somewhat confusing.

On CPU, you get the proper message:

```
RuntimeError: Calculated padded input size per channel: (2 x 2). Kernel size: (4 x 4). Kernel size can't greater than actual input size at [...]
```

On GPU it renders as

```
Expected tensor for argument #1 'input' to have the same dimension as tensor for 'result'; but 4 does not equal 2 (while checking arguments for cudnn_convolution)
```

So @yngtodd, providing the network with a larger input (or adapting the network architecture) will likely fix your issue.

(`PyTorch Version: 0.4.0`)
